definition: (music) a half-beat behind/(fig.) rather slow (in performing a task, comprehending etc)
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: There is always something, every time to hear, slow heartbeat.
sentences.chinese: 总有一些话，每次听见，心跳慢半拍。

sentences.english: It's really me who is being slow.
sentences.chinese: 看来，那个慢半拍的人是我才对。

sentences.english: We all have a friend with a retarded laugh.
sentences.chinese: 我们都有这样一个朋友，笑的时候永远慢半拍。

sentences.english: Sorry a lot of exhibitors due to slow by half a beat missed.
sentences.chinese: 惋惜不少展商由于慢半拍失之交臂。

definition: slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
